messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go

LGTM

https://codereview.appspot.com/7597046/diff/4001/src/pkg/runtime/signal_netbsd_arm.h
File src/pkg/runtime/signal_netbsd_arm.h (right):

https://codereview.appspot.com/7597046/diff/4001/src/pkg/runtime/signal_netbsd_arm.h#newcode7
src/pkg/runtime/signal_netbsd_arm.h:7: // index to the __gregs array of an mcontext
Any reason not to get these defines via defs_netbsd_arm.h, like we do for netbsd/386 and netbsd/amd64?

On 2013/03/17 01:28:39, jsing wrote:
> Any reason not to get these defines via defs_netbsd_arm.h, like we do for
> netbsd/386 and netbsd/amd64?
the old defs_netbsd_arm.h is manually edited.
i will update a new patch set that use cgo to generate these constants.

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com, jsing@google.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

Please take another look.

On 2013/03/17 16:54:35, minux wrote:
> Hello mailto:golang-dev@googlegroups.com, mailto:jsing@google.com (cc:
> mailto:golang-dev@googlegroups.com),
> 
> Please take another look.

LGTM

*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=07e7d82f760e ***

runtime: fix build for NetBSD/ARM

R=golang-dev, jsing
CC=golang-dev
https://codereview.appspot.com/7597046

subject: code review 7597046: runtime: fix build for NetBSD/ARM
